body_html:
The reason some files in ATen gained a CuDNN suffix is because the HCC compiler has linking issues for files that have the same name.

As for the state of the code base, there are 27 patch files now that basically need to remain until I add more functionality upstream to HIP. For e.g., HIP treated fp16 as a first class type and CUDA treated it as a struct w/ a short, so I needed to add a similar structure upstream, allowing me to get rid of all the patches touching Half. (The number of THC patches are down to 6 now.)

As for the state of the code base, there are 27 patch files now that basically need to remain until I add more functionality upstream to HIP. For e.g., HIP treated fp16 as a first class type and CUDA treated it as a struct w/ a short, so I needed to add a similar structure upstream, allowing me to get rid of all the patches touching Half.  (The number of THC patches are down to 6 now.)
body:
The reason some files in ATen gained a CuDNN suffix is because the HCC compiler has linking issues for files that have the same name.

As for the state of the code base, there are 27 patch files now that basically need to remain until I add more functionality upstream to HIP. For e.g., HIP treated fp16 as a first class type and CUDA treated it as a struct w/ a short, so I needed to add a similar structure upstream, allowing me to get rid of all the patches touching Half.  (The number of THC patches are down to 6 now.)
